options.title: Fish and Wildlife Habitat Conservation Areas

fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content: At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the pin on your property.

fields.name: private-address
fields.prompt: Or, search by address:
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: practice_types_header
fields.content: 2. Land Use

fields.name: practice_types
fields.prompt: Which of the following uses apply to your land? (Check all that apply)

fields.name: practice_types_questions
fields.content: Questions? Call Doug Phelps at 509-535-7274 x240

fields.name: agriculture_header
fields.content: 3. Agriculture

fields.name: no_till
fields.prompt: No till
fields.label: No till

body: No till consists of one pass seed and fertilizer placement.

fields.name: no_till_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you practice no till?

fields.name: no_till_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been practicing no till?

fields.name: conventional_till
fields.prompt: Conventional till
fields.label: Conventional till

body: This practice consists of multiple tillage passes with soil inversion and seed bed preparation

fields.name: conventional_till_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use conventional till techniques?

fields.name: conventinal_till_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been using conventional till techniques?

fields.name: reduced_till
fields.prompt: Reduced till
fields.label: Reduced till

body: This practice consists of seed and fertilizer placement while allowing the majority of crop residue and stubble to remain on the ground.

fields.name: reduced_till_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use reduced till techniques?

fields.name: reduced_till_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been using reduced till techniques?

fields.name: soil_tests
fields.prompt: Do you conduct soil tests?
fields.label: Soil tests

body: Soil tests monitor, at a minimum, organic matter, phosphorus (P), potassium (K), pH, and buffer pH every four years.

fields.name: soil_tests_zone_map
fields.prompt: Do you zone and map your fields based off of soil tests?

fields.name: soil_tests_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you conduct soil tests?

fields.name: soil_tests_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been conducting soil tests?

fields.name: fertilization
fields.prompt: How do you fertilize your field?
fields.label: Field fertilization

fields.prompt: Choose all fertilization types that apply:

fields.name: synthetic_fertilization_zone_map
fields.prompt: Have you developed a zone map for synthetic fertilization?

fields.name: organic_fertilization_yield_map
fields.prompt: Do you base your organic fertilizing off of a yield map?

fields.name: organic_fertilization_zone_map
fields.prompt: Have you developed a zone map for organic fertilization?

fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use synthetic fertilizer?

fields.name: synthetic_fertilization_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been fertilizing your fields synthetically?

fields.name: organic_fertilization_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use organic fertilizer?

fields.name: organic_fertilization_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been fertilizing your fields organically?

fields.name: buffers
fields.prompt: Do you have buffers on your waterways?
fields.label: Buffers

fields.name: buffer_types
fields.prompt: Which types of buffers do you have on your waterways?

fields.name: other_buffer_type
fields.prompt: Do you have any other types of buffers on your property?

fields.name: other_buffer_type_description
fields.prompt: Please describe your other buffer(s)

fields.name: buffers_quantity
fields.prompt: How many feet of buffers have you installed?

fields.name: buffers_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing buffers?

fields.name: buffer_program
fields.prompt: Did you install these buffers through a program?

fields.name: buffer_program_types
fields.prompt: Which programs? (check all that apply)

fields.name: grassed_waterways
fields.prompt: Grassed waterways
fields.label: Grassed waterways

body: A grassed waterway is a shaped or graded channel that is established with suitable vegetation to convey surface water at a non-erosive velocity using a broad and shallow cross section to a stable outlet.

fields.name: grassed_waterways_quantity
fields.prompt: On how many acres do you use grassed waterways?

fields.name: grassed_waterways_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been using grassed waterways?

fields.name: commodity_buffer
fields.prompt: I participate in the commodity buffer program
fields.label: Commodity buffer program

fields.name: commodity_buffer_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been participating in the commodity buffer program?

fields.name: riparian_forest
fields.prompt: Do you have any wildlife habitat enhancements on your property?
fields.label: Wildlife habitat enhancements

body: A corridor of trees and/or shrubs planted adjacent to a river, stream, wetland or water body. The planting is of sufficient width and up-gradient and near the water body to insure adequate functioning for the desired purpose.

fields.name: riparian_forest_quantity
fields.prompt: How many acres of wildlife habitat have you enhanced?

fields.name: riparian_forest_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been enhancing wildlife habitat?

fields.name: riparian_forest_description
fields.prompt: Please describe your wildlife habitat enhancements:

fields.name: agriculture_questions
fields.content: Questions? Call Doug Phelps at 509-535-7274 x240

fields.name: livestock_header
fields.content: 4. Livestock

fields.name: stream_crossing
fields.prompt: Stream crossings
fields.label: Stream crossings

body: A stream crossing is a stabilized area or structure constructed across a stream to provide a travel way for people, livestock, equipment, or vehicles.

fields.name: stream_crossing_type
fields.prompt: Which types of crossings have you installed? (Check all that apply)

fields.name: stream_crossing_quantity
fields.prompt: How many stream crossings have you installed?

fields.name: stream_crossing_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing stream crossings?

fields.name: fencing
fields.prompt: Fencing
fields.label: Fencing

body: There are many different purposes for and types of fences. Generally, fences shall be appropriately planned, designed, and installed to control the animal(s), vehicles, or people of concern.

fields.name: fencing_quantity
fields.prompt: How many feet of fencing have you installed?

fields.name: fencing_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been installing and maintaining fencing?

fields.name: mud_manure_management

fields.label: Mud and manure management

fields.name: mud_manure_management_type
fields.prompt: Which types of mud and manure management do you practice? (Check all that apply)

fields.name: mud_manure_management_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been practicing mud and manure management?

fields.label: Off creek stock watering

fields.name: off_creek_stock_watering_duration
fields.prompt: For how long have you been maintaining off creek stock watering systems?

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Place your pin on the map? (Your address and other property identifying information will not be published.)

content: Your Spokane County VSP Coordinators are interested in helping meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator for more information:

Welcome Spokane County Voluntary Stewards!

Share Your Stewardship

The Spokane County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) is an innovative approach to reporting the protection of critical areas. By reporting your voluntary stewardship on this site, you'll help Spokane County allocate resources, and you'll help the Spokane County Conservation District learn what types of technical assistance we can provide to you.
Sign up for Opportunities & Assistance
Stewardship Practices Examples and Funding Opportunities
The Spokane Conservation District partners with other agencies such as the NRCS and the WSCC to match landowners with programs that best fit their needs.
Contact Walt Edelen or Doug Phelps with questions:
Management TypeConservation PracticesNRCS CodePotential Funding
TillageConservation Tillage No-Till329$35-$50/acre (max 1,500 acres per entity)
TillageConservation Tillage Mulch-Till345Up to $45/acre (max 1,500 acres per entity)
NutrientsSoil Tests, Fertilizers and Mapping590Up to $28/acre (max 350 acres per entity)
Buffers/Habitat ManagementVarious types of vegetated riparian buffers and streambank/shoreline stabilizationVarious$30-$500/acre (3-15 year commitments)
ForestForest Stand Improvement (thinning, pruning and slash treatment)660/666Typically about $1,000/acre
ForestTree and Shrub Establishment612Typically about $400/acre
